bibl.title: Letter from Walter Reed to Theobald Smith, July 19, 1901

div1.p: Reed discusses cultures of Bacillus Icteroides. He will send the cultures to Smith.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to Theobald Smith, July 19, 1901
div1.opener:
Jr Ks
copy of
W. Reed
WAR DEPARTMENT,
SURGEON GENERAL'S OFFICE,
ARMY MEDICAL MUSEUM AND LIBRARY,
WASHINGTON.
July 19, 1901.
My dear Dr Smith:
div1.p:
In reply
to yours of the 17th, I regret
to state that the only Cul-
tures of b. icteroides which
we have on hand are
certain original cultures;
viz: Sanarelli's culture re-
ceived from Roux in the fall
of 1897: B. icteroides, Santiago,
isolated by Agramonte
at Santiago, Cuba, in the Sum-
mer of 1898, and B. icteroides,
Havana, isolated from a
case of Typhoid fever by Agra-
monte at Havana in april
1899 -- I will gladly forward
these cultures to you, by to-
morrow's mail- Sanarelli's
original culture, when last
used by us, in 1899, was
still virulent for rabbits
& guinea pigs- I trust that
you may find these cult-
ures of service to you
in your work-
div1.closer:
With kind regards,
Sincerely, yours, Walter Reed.
